segment.source: MD Conversion - Windows PC management capabilities in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Windows PC management capabilities in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Windows PC management capabilities in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Windows PC management capabilities in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: You can use to manage Windows PCs with the Intune client installed.
segment.target: You can use to manage Windows PCs with the Intune client installed.

segment.source: PC management lets you deploy apps and software including software updates to your managed PCs, manage Endpoint Protection and the Windows Firewall, and more.
segment.target: PC management lets you deploy apps and software including software updates to your managed PCs, manage Endpoint Protection and the Windows Firewall, and more.

segment.source: Below are a list of supported configurations and capabilities.
segment.target: Below are a list of supported configurations and capabilities.

segment.source: Requirements for PC management
segment.target: Requirements for PC management

segment.source: Operating Systems:
segment.target: Operating Systems:

segment.source: You can install the client on PCs that run the following operating systems (both x86 and x64):
segment.target: You can install the client on PCs that run the following operating systems (both x86 and x64):

segment.source: Windows Vista - Business, Enterprise and Ultimate versions.
segment.target: Windows Vista - Business, Enterprise and Ultimate versions.

segment.source: Windows 7 - Professional, Enterprise, and Ultimate versions (with no service pack, or with SP1).
segment.target: Windows 7 - Professional, Enterprise, and Ultimate versions (with no service pack, or with SP1).

segment.source: Windows 8 - Professional and Enterprise versions.
segment.target: Windows 8 - Professional and Enterprise versions.

segment.source: Windows 8.1 - Professional and Enterprise versions.
segment.target: Windows 8.1 - Professional and Enterprise versions.

segment.source: Windows 10 - Professional and Enterprise versions.
segment.target: Windows 10 - Professional and Enterprise versions.

segment.source: Hardware:
segment.target: Hardware:

segment.source: The following are minimum hardware requirements for installing the client:
segment.target: The following are minimum hardware requirements for installing the client:

segment.source: Requirement
segment.target: Requirement

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Network
segment.target: Network

segment.source: The client requires the PC to have Internet connectivity.
segment.target: The client requires the PC to have Internet connectivity.

segment.source: Processor and Memory
segment.target: Processor and Memory

segment.source: Refer to the processor and RAM requirements for the PC's operating system.
segment.target: Refer to the processor and RAM requirements for the PC's operating system.

segment.source: Disk space
segment.target: Disk space

segment.source: 200 MB available disk space before the client software is installed.
segment.target: 200 MB available disk space before the client software is installed.

segment.source: Software:
segment.target: Software:

segment.source: The following are software requirements for installing the client:
segment.target: The following are software requirements for installing the client:

segment.source: Requirement
segment.target: Requirement

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Administrative permissions
segment.target: Administrative permissions

segment.source: The account that installs the client software must have local administrator permissions to that PC.
segment.target: The account that installs the client software must have local administrator permissions to that PC.

segment.source: Windows Installer 3.1
segment.target: Windows Installer 3.1

segment.source: The PC must have, at a minimum, Windows Installer 3.1.
segment.target: The PC must have, at a minimum, Windows Installer 3.1.

segment.source: To view the version of Windows Installer on a PC, right-click %windir%\System32\msiexec.exe, and then click Properties.
segment.target: To view the version of Windows Installer on a PC, right-click %windir%\System32\msiexec.exe, and then click Properties.

segment.source: You can download the latest version of Windows Installer from Windows Installer Redistributables on the Microsoft Developer Network website.
segment.target: You can download the latest version of Windows Installer from Windows Installer Redistributables on the Microsoft Developer Network website.

segment.source: Remove incompatible client software
segment.target: Remove incompatible client software

segment.source: Before you install the client software, you must first uninstall any version of , , or Systems Management Server (SMS).
segment.target: Before you install the client software, you must first uninstall any version of , , or Systems Management Server (SMS).

segment.source: Intune PC management capabilities
segment.target: Intune PC management capabilities

segment.source: Manage software updates You can keep PCs up-to-date, and manage when updates are applied.
segment.target: Manage software updates You can keep PCs up-to-date, and manage when updates are applied.

segment.source: Windows Firewall policy This helps to ensure that no PC used by your company has an inactive or improperly-configured Windows Firewall.
segment.target: Windows Firewall policy This helps to ensure that no PC used by your company has an inactive or improperly-configured Windows Firewall.

segment.source: Anti-malware protection includes Endpoint Protection, which helps protect your PCs from malware.
segment.target: Anti-malware protection includes Endpoint Protection, which helps protect your PCs from malware.

segment.source: Remote assistance allows users to contact IT support staff, who can then provide assistance using a remote desktop feature that is included with .
segment.target: Remote assistance allows users to contact IT support staff, who can then provide assistance using a remote desktop feature that is included with .

segment.source: Software license management.
segment.target: Software license management.

segment.source: Track how many software licenses are available, and how many available licenses are being used.
segment.target: Track how many software licenses are available, and how many available licenses are being used.
